comments:
I'm experiencing some difficulty attempting to work with the current CDT release
obtained from http://update.eclipse.org/tools/cdt/updates/release with eclipse
3.0M3 under OS X. The problem appears to be with the editor itself, as anytime
that I attempt to open a .c, .h, or .cpp file with the C/C++ editor I get an
error dialog with the message "Unable to create part: <filename>". I've googled
for this, and haven't found any direct references in regards to this problem
occuring with the CDT itself, so I'm somewhat at a loss as to what to do beyond
potentially building the CDT source manually.

Please try to find more information about the "Unable to create part..." message in the
<workspace>/.metadata/.log
file

The version you have for the bug is 1.1 is that correct? If so could you try one
of the latest builds.

The log from workspace/.metadata/.log shows the error as follows:

I would try a more recent build, except I don't seem to be able to get one
installed effectively through the update manager. Upon trying to install a build
(ie, version 1.2.0.61 or 1.2.0.60) I get 3 packages to choose from (development
tools (source), managed make build system, and standard make build system). I'm
able to select the source feature, though neither of the make build system
options, as these result in unmet dependancies in the form of "Feature requires
feature "org.eclipse.cdt (1.2.0.61)", or compatible." Should I be downloading
the source package and attempting to get it to rebuild? or is there an alternate
location from where I can fetch a more recent CDT snapshot aside from the daily
build page?

The reason this doesn't work is that it would appear that you are using Eclipse
3.0 and CDT does not support it at this time. Sorry...
HEAD branch should now build with Eclipse 3.0
